author: mona brar
text:
I purchased a Hamilton watch listed for £450, the website mentioned its in 'good' condition. We didn't receive the watch until 8 months later as the parcel went missing and i received an email to tell me the box had been damaged and being returned back to them. I:

-Received it  8 months later then the purchase date (refund was refused in that time it was missing as they kept saying it was on its way) 
-paid 65 for customs, was charged this again on delivery
- when it came, it was scratched, old, and one stap was a fake generic strap, the other fabric strap had stains on it.
- After a couple of weeks we noticed the time kept slowing down an stopping. We had to pay 150 additional to fix that. They told me because i didnt inform within 7 days i can't get a refund (even though the law states anything fault within 6 months can be considered faulty to begin with).

When i informed them they told me to relist it (prior to me fixing it). That means their happy for me to sell broken goods. They only want their cut. 

Worse transaction i went through in my life. I deleted my account after to resist temptations and deleted all their notifications. The watch would have been cheaper to buy brand new. And the fact i have to inform them in 7 days but they think 8 months to deliver is reasonable.
title: The company has a lot of work to do

author: LM
text:
I’ve been a loyal customer of VC since 2017 but I’m closing my account as soon as my dispute is over because this company is becoming extremely “unethical”. Standard of their inspection and Customer Service have become shockingly bad and they are only focusing on making commissions now. 

To share my latest experience;

1. I bought a Hermes dress but wasn’t happy with its condition - product was not washed so it had really bad smell. It was also more worn-out than the advertised “very good condition”

2. I requested refund by sending product photos and was given a shipping label to send it back to VC Hong Kong (city where I reside)

3. I got a notification saying that I listed the product for re-sale and VC will charge me a commission for this - very cofusing!

4. I contacted CS and got a reply saying it’s a mistake and I’ll be given a full refund

5. Another CS person wrote me the following day and said VC listed the product for resale because they refuse to give me a refund. Their inspector thinks the product is “compliant” to be in a “very good condition” which is a total nonsense :) I was told to wait until the product sells if I want my money back

4. I disputed the decision but my opinion on the dirty and more worn-out product condition was ignored again with no supporting details

5. I asked the dress to be sent back to me (to my home address in Hong Kong) as I found it extremely “unethical” VC is attempting to make double commission on this dress, screwing over unhappy customer who’s been loyal for so many years.

6. I received a reply saying the dress is now at VC warehouse in France and cannot be shipped to the UK due to VAT issues??? But I live in Hong Kong!!!

I’ve been in this never ending, disastrous purchasing experience for two weeks now and wonder if I’ll ever get my money or at least the dress back??? 

VC was good back in the days but I don’t think it will survive for much longer in the market because they’ve lost core of their business ; Product Quality and Customer Satisfaction!!
title: Extremely unethical business practices

author: Tara Jones
text:
At first, I loved shopping on Vestiaire - they have good product options over a variety of sellers and types of products. But BEWARE, they have the worst customer service out of any platform I have ever seen. I purchased a product that, shortly after purchasing I realized was gravely misrepresented in the listing (I basically thought I was buying a purse and it was in fact the size of my palm”. I reached out to Vestiaire immediately about the issue to see if we could cancel the order before the item was shipped. I was told that, although they agree that the item was misrepresented, the Seller is the only one that can cancel the order. I reached out to the seller and she refused to cancel in order not to hurt her “selling reputation”. Once I actually received the item, I reached out to Vestiaire again. I have been tossed around with about 5 representatives for a complaint that I filed. Finally after days, they just told me that they agree the item is misrepresented but I didn’t reach out within 72 hours of receiving the item so there’s nothing that they can do. Plus, I reached out before the item was even shipped. Many other sites will give you a one time leeway but not here!

Anyways, what I am saying is you can find some good stuff on this site. There’s also a chance that you will pay $300 for a keychain that fits absolutely nothing. If you have money to waste, go for it.
title: TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE

author: Nancy
text: So after many weeks the DHL invoice sage (which I shouldn't have received in the first place) is still unresolved.  I have been passed from Grace, to Marianne and now to Sarah Jane.  All these 'customer services' people are great at wishing me a lovely day but not one of them has sorted this issue out.   I was told by Grace to 'disregard' the bill and now I'm being told by Sarah Jane to pay it and I'll get reimbursed.....  Who believes that ?!? would ever happen.  So from a matter which could be simply resolved by this company completing the necessary form, which has been sent by email several times, I am being passed from pillar to post and guess what.. nothing is being resolved.  This company has very very poor reviews, and now researching online I can see exactly why.   There are major flaws and issues and all I can say is my experience is so unprofessional I am determined to never ever use them again.  I'd rather shop with confidence, then have to experience weeks and weeks of chat and emails and get absolutely nowhere.  If anyone from Vestiaire is reading this, can you please look into this matter and resolve it..  Don't ask me to pay this bill that should never have been sent to me.  This matter has gone on for far too long.... we are now entering around the 5th week of me bringing this matter to your attention.  I am very disappointed to say the least and this has hung over me all through the holiday time... let's see who else picks this up seeing as the last 3 people have done nothing!!!
title: Avoid Vestiaire at all cost..if you want peace of mind...
